title: " Beginner's Gardening Guide: Grow Your First Garden Like a Pro in Just 90 Seconds! "

subtasks: Determine gardening goals (e.g., vegetables, herbs, flowers)
Assess garden space for sunlight, soil, layout
Choose climate-appropriate, easy-to-grow plants (e.g., tomatoes, basil, marigolds)
Acquire essential tools (trowel, hand fork, pruners, gloves, watering can)
Clear garden area of weeds and debris
Loosen soil and incorporate organic matter (compost)
Select garden style (in-ground beds, raised beds, containers) based on space and needs
Decide on starting seeds or seedlings, considering cost and convenience
Plant seeds or seedlings correctly (seeds at proper depth, spacing; seedlings hardened off)
Water plants gently and establish optimal growing conditions
Apply mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds
Fertilize with organic options (e.g., compost, fish emulsion)
Regularly prune plants to encourage growth and manage pests using natural remedies
Harvest vegetables and herbs when mature, cutting properly
Cut flowers in the morning for freshness
